datea 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Coerce to year month

Source: R/ym-as.R
as_ym.Rd

  • Date, POSIXct, and POSIXlt are converted directly by extracting the year and month from x. Any day, hour, minute, or second components are dropped. Time zone information is not retained.

  • Integer and double input are assumed to be the number of months since the Unix origin of 1970-01-01.

  • Character input is assumed to be provided in a format containing only information about the year and month, such as "1970-01" or "Jan 1970". It is parsed using the defaults of ym_parse().

as_ym(x, ...)

# S3 method for Date
as_ym(x, ...)

# S3 method for POSIXct
as_ym(x, ...)

# S3 method for POSIXlt
as_ym(x, ...)

# S3 method for integer
as_ym(x, ...)

# S3 method for double
as_ym(x, ...)

# S3 method for character
as_ym(x, ...)

Arguments

x

[vector]

An object to coerce to ym.
...

Not used.

Examples

# Extra information such as days, hours, or time zones are dropped
as_ym(as.Date("2019-05-03"))
#> <ym[1]>
#> [1] 2019-05
as_ym(as.POSIXct("2019-03-04 01:01:01", tz = "America/New_York"))
#> <ym[1]>
#> [1] 2019-03

# Integers are interpreted as the number of months since 1970-01-01
as_ym(0L)
#> <ym[1]>
#> [1] 1970-01
as_ym(12L)
#> <ym[1]>
#> [1] 1971-01
